Review:
The course I chose was CSE because I like this field and also the placement package is nice. The curriculum, at first might seem unnecessary but as you study more you find that more or less everything in the course is necessary.
There are two groups in each branch, i.e, about 60 students and there are two professors for each group for a particular subject. Also, both the groups are further divided into three sub-groups, i.e, a total of six sub-groups for labs, and a professor is assigned to each sub-group.
All the professors are not too good, not too bad just like the normal stereotypical image of a professor in an engineering college. 
The college conducts mid-term and end-term examinations in a semester. Also, quizzes and lab assignments are also conducted. We have midterms after two and a half months after the start of the semester and end terms after the same amount of time.
Passing exams is easy if you just study occasionally even before the exams, you can pass.

A low faculty: student ratio means that students can receive more personalized attention from the faculty, which can result in a better learning experience. Heading: IET Lucknow
Review: In the first year, the course is the same for all branches. After that, branch-specific subjects become the major part of the curriculum. There are almost 60-70 students in a class. The plus point is you get a lot of free time because the class schedule is loose and can work on yourself. Each semester has two CTs(class tests) and one end-sem exam for each subject.

Talking about the library, there are plenty of books. Every book related to academics will be present there. There's not much importance for sports in our college. They'll not allow us to play most of the time. There are some clubs for photography, cinematography, acting, dancing, singing, etc. These clubs are organised by students.

They go with 1to 1 interact with the students and organise various seminars, career counselling programmes, and alumni meetings so as to acknowledge children about the several courses and college history. All the teaching faculty are PhD holders and stand excellent in their respective fields of knowledge. The teaching process is mainly done by the board system in this course and the classes are run by a systematic timetable which is provided by the faculty members themselves.  There is a semester system and the exam is conducted every 6 months for the duration of 3 years if pursuing the undergraduate course. But according to NEP 3 years is shifted to 4 years. Exam pattern is very easy if the student has studied.
